member.summary: Adds a filter for a filter column.

member.remarks: MS Excel 2007 supports multiple selection in a filter column.

member.summary: Gets the string value contained in the cell. If the type of this cell is string, then return the string value itself. For other cell types, the formatted string value (formatted with the specified style of this cell) will be returned. The formatted cell value is same with what you can get from excel when copying a cell as text(such as copying cell to text editor or exporting to csv).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Cell.SetDynamicArrayFormula(System.String,Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets dynamic array formula and make the formula spill into neighboring cells if possible.
member.param: options to parse formula. "Parse" option will be ignored and the formula will always be parsed immediately
whether calculate this dynamic array formula for those cells in the spilled range.
member.returns: the range that the formula should spill into.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Cell.SetDynamicArrayFormula(System.String,Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions,System.Object[][],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets dynamic array formula and make the formula spill into neighboring cells if possible.
member.param: options to parse formula. "Parse" option will be ignored and the formula will always be parsed immediately
values for those cells with given dynamic array formula

Whether calculate the spilled range for this dynamic array formula. If the "values" parameter is not null and this flag is false, then the spilled range's height will be values.Length and width will be values[0].Length.
whether calculate this dynamic array formula for those cells in the spilled range when "values" is null or corresponding item in "values" for one cell is null.
member.returns: the range that the formula should spill into.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Cell.SetAddInFormula(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets an Add-In formula to the cell.
member.remarks: Add-In file should be placed in the directory or sub-directory of Workbook Add-In library. For example, file name can be "Eurotool.xla" or "solver\solver.xla". NOTE: This class is now obsolete. Instead, please use Cell.Formula/Cell.SetFormula() to set cell formula with the Add-In functions after registering it by WorksheetCollection.RegisterAddInFunction(). This property will be removed 12 months later since January 2019. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cell.Value
member.summary: Gets the value contained in this cell.
member.remarks:
Possible type:
null,
Boolean,
DateTime,
Double,
Integer
String. For int value, it may be returned as an Integer object or a Double object. And there is no guarantee that the returned value will be kept as the same type of object always.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Cells.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the cells enumerator.
member.remarks: When traversing elements by the returned Enumerator, the cells collection should not be modified(such as operations that will cause new Cell/Row be instantiated or existing Cell/Row be deleted). Otherwise the enumerator may not be able to traverse all cells correctly(some elements may be traversed repeatedly or skipped).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cells.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell row index and column index.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells[0, 0]; //Gets the cell at "A1"
[Visual Basic]
Dim cells As Cells = excel.Worksheets(0).Cells Dim cell As Cell = cells(0,0) 'Gets the cell at "A1"

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cells.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell name.
member.param: Cell name,including its column letter and row number, for example A5.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells["A1"]; //Gets the cell at "A1"
[Visual Basic]
Dim cells As Cells = excel.Worksheets(0).Cells Dim cell As Cell = cells("A1") 'Gets the cell at "A1"

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cells.MultiThreadReading
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cells data model should support Multi-Thread reading. Default value of this property is false. If there are multiple threads to read Row/Cell objects in this collection concurrently, this property should be set as true, otherwise unexpected result may be produced. Supporting Multi-Thread reading may degrade the performance for accessing Row/Cell objects from this collection.

member.remarks: This method automatically format date time values. However, if the DateTable is very huge, this method may slow down the program. In this case, you'd better format the cell manually.

members.member:
Link to a xml map.
name of xml map row of the destination cell column of the destination cell path of xml element in xml map e.g. A xml map element structure:
-RootElement |-Attribute1 |-SubElement |-Attribute2 |-Attribute3
To link "Attribute1", path is "/RootElement/Attribute1" To link "Attribute2", path is "/RootElement/SubElement/Attribute2" To link whole "SubElement", path is "/RootElement/SubElement"

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions
member.summary: Cache options for data access. Can be combined with | operator for multiple options together.
member.remarks:
For some features, accessing large dataset requires a lot of repeated and complicated operations such as search, calculation, ...etc and those operations will take a lot of extra time. For common situations, all dependent data remains unchanged during the access, so some caches can be built and used to improve the access performance. For this purpose, we provide this API so that user can specify which kind of data access needs to be optimized by possible caching mechanism.
Please note, for different options, different data set may be required to be "read-only". And performance of accessing data depends on many aspects, the use of caching mechanism does not guarantee that performance will be improved. For some situations, such as the dataset to be accessed is small, using cache may cause even more time because caching itself also needs certain extra time.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.None
member.summary: No cache for any data access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.All
member.summary: Apply all possible optimizations for all kinds of data access in the workbook. All settings and data should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.PositionAndSize
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for getting object(such as Shape)'s position and size. Row height and column width settings should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.CellsData
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for getting cells' values. Cells data(data and settings of Cell, Row) should not be changed during the optimized access, no new Cell/Row objects should be created either(such as by ).

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.CellDisplay
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for getting display-related results of cells(, , , etc.). Cells data and style-related objects(Cell/Row/Column styles, column width, etc.) should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.GetFormula
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for getting formulas. All data and settings which may affect the formula expression(Worksheet's name, Name's text, table's column, etc.) should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.SetFormula
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for setting formulas. All data and settings which may affect the formula expression(Worksheet's name, Name's text, table's column, etc.) should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.CalculateFormula
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for calculating formulas. Cells data should not be changed during the optimized access, none new objects(Cell, Row, etc.) should be created either(such as by ).

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.ConditionalFormatting
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for getting formatting result of conditional formattings. All data and settings which may affect the result of conditional formattings(settings of conditional formattings, dependent cell values, etc.) should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions.Validation
member.summary: Apply possible optimization for getting validation result. All data and settings which may affect the result of validation(settings of the validation, dependent cell values, etc.) should not be changed during the optimized access.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.MemorySetting

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.MemorySetting.Normal
member.summary: Default option for cells model.
member.remarks: This option is applied for all versions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.MemorySetting.MemoryPreference
member.summary: Memory performance preferrable. With this option the data will be held in compact format so for common scenarios it may give lower memory cost. However, this option also may degrade R/W performance a bit in some special cases.
member.remarks: This option is available since v 8.0.0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution for generated images, in dots per inch. Applies generating image method except Emf format images.

member.remarks: The default value is 96.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.TiffCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of compression to apply only when saving pages to the Tiff format.
member.remarks: Has effect only when saving to TIFF. The default value is Lzw.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.TiffColorDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets bit depth to apply only when saving pages to the Tiff format.
member.remarks: Has effect only when saving to TIFF. If TiffCompression is set to CCITT3, CCITT4, this will not take effect, the bit depth of the generated tiff image will be always 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.PrintingPage
member.summary: Indicates which pages will not be printed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the quality of the generated images to apply only when saving pages to the Jpeg format. The default value is 100
member.remarks: Has effect only when saving to JPEG. The value must be between 0 and 100. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.ImageType
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the generated images. Don't apply the method that returns a Bitmap object.
member.remarks: The default value is ImageFormat.Bmp. Don't apply the method that returns a Bitmap object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.IsCellAutoFit
member.summary: Indicates whether the width and height of the cells is automatically fitted by cell value. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.IsImageFitToPage
member.summary: When set the value to true, the page only include the cells that have data. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.OnePagePerSheet
member.summary: If OnePagePerSheet is true , all content of one sheet will output to only one page in result. The paper size of pagesetup will be invalid, and the other settings of pagesetup will still take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.AllColumnsInOnePagePerSheet
member.summary: If AllColumnsInOnePagePerSheet is true , all column content of one sheet will output to only one page in result. The width of paper size of pagesetup will be invalid, and the other settings of pagesetup will still take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.DrawObjectEventHandler
member.summary: Implements this interface to get DrawObject and Bound when rendering.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.ChartImageType
member.summary: Indicate the chart imagetype when converting.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.EmbededImageNameInSvg
member.summary: Indicate the filename of embedded image in svg. This should be full path with directory like "c:\\xpsEmbedded"

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.SVGFitToViewPort
member.summary: if this property is true, the generated svg will fit to view port.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.OnlyArea
member.summary: If this property is true , one Area will be output, and no scale will take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Specifies the quality of text rendering. The default value is TextRenderingHint.SystemDefault

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.SmoothingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to lines and curves and the edges of filled areas. The default value is SmoothingMode.None

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.Transparent
member.summary: Indicates if the background of generated image should be transparent.
member.remarks: The default value is false. That means the background of the generated images is white.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel format for the generated images.
member.remarks: The default value is PixelFormat.Format32bppArgb.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.WarningCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets warning callback.

member.summary: Control/Indicate progress of page saving process.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.IsFontSubstitutionCharGranularity
member.summary: Indicates whether only substitute the font of character when the cell font is not compatibility for it.
member.remarks: Default is false. We will try default font of Workbook and PdfSaveOption/system for cell font first.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the 0-based index of the first page to save.
member.remarks: Default is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.PageCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages to save.
member.remarks: Default is System.Int32.MaxValue which means all pages will be rendered..

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.SetDesiredSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets desired width and height of image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.DefaultFont
member.summary: When characters in the Excel are unicode and not be set with correct font in cell style, They may appear as block in pdf,image. Set the DefaultFont such as MingLiu or MS Gothic to show these characters. If this property is not set, Aspose.Cells will use system default font to show these unicode characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.CheckWorkbookDefaultFont
member.summary: When characters in the Excel are unicode and not be set with correct font in cell style, They may appear as block in pdf,image. Set this to true to try to use workbook's default font to show these characters first.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.OutputBlankPageWhenNothingToPrint
member.summary: Indicates whether to output a blank page when there is nothing to print.
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.GridlineType
member.summary: Gets or sets gridline type.
member.remarks: Default is Dotted type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.TextCrossType
member.summary: Gets or sets displaying text type when the text width is larger than cell width.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.EmfType
member.summary: Gets or sets an EmfType that specifies the format of the Metafile.. The default value is EmfPlusDual.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions.DefaultEditLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets default edit language.
member.remarks: It may display/render different layouts for text paragraph when different edit languages is set. Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.ActiveXControls.CheckBoxActiveXControl.IsTripleState
member.summary: Indicates how the specified control will display Null values.
member.remarks:
///
SettingDescription
TrueThe control will cycle through states for Yes, No, and Null values. The control appears dimmed (grayed) when its Value property is set to Null.
False(Default) The control will cycle through states for Yes and No values. Null values display as if they were No values.

member.summary: Indicates whether dragging and dropping is enabled for the control.

member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the ENTER key. True specifies that pressing ENTER will create a new line. False specifies that pressing ENTER will move the focus to the next object in the tab order.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.ActiveXControls.TextBoxActiveXControl.EnterFieldBehavior
member.summary: Specifies selection behavior when entering the control. True specifies that the selection remains unchanged from last time the control was active. False specifies that all the text in the control will be selected when entering the control.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.ActiveXControls.TextBoxActiveXControl.TabKeyBehavior
member.summary: Indicates whether tab characters are allowed in the text of the control.

member.summary: Indicates whether selected text in the control appears highlighted when the control does not have focus.

member.summary: Indicates whether the focus will automatically move to the next control when the user enters the maximum number of characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.ActiveXControls.TextBoxActiveXControl.IsMultiLine
member.summary: Indicates whether the control can display more than one line of text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.ActiveXControls.TextBoxActiveXControl.IsAutoWordSelected
member.summary: Specifies the basic unit used to extend a selection. True specifies that the basic unit is a single character. false specifies that the basic unit is a whole word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.ActiveXControls.ToggleButtonActiveXControl.IsTripleState
member.summary: Indicates how the specified control will display Null values.
member.remarks:
///
SettingDescription
TrueThe control will cycle through states for Yes, No, and Null values. The control appears dimmed (grayed) when its Value property is set to Null.
False(Default) The control will cycle through states for Yes and No values. Null values display as if they were No values.

member.summary: Returns the gradient degree for the specified fill. Only applies for Excel 2007.
member.remarks: Can only be a value from 0.0 (dark) through 1.0 (light).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.FillFormat.GradientVariant
member.summary: Returns the gradient variant for the specified fill. Only applies for Excel 2007.
member.remarks: Can only be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.OleObject.SetEmbeddedObject(System.Boolean,System.Byte[],System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Sets embedded object data.
member.param: Indicates whether the object links to the file. If true, the parameter objectData is ignored.
Indicates whether diplaying object as an icon. If true, the orginal image data will be covered by icon.
The icon label. Only works when displayAsIcon as true.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.OleObject.SetEmbeddedObject(System.Boolean,System.Byte[],System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets embedded object data.
member.param: Indicates whether the object links to the file. If true, the parameter objectData is ignored.
Indicates whether diplaying object as an icon. If true, the orginal image data will be covered by icon.
The icon label. Only works when displayAsIcon as true.
member.remarks: As Aspose can update embedd all file icons, so it's better that you can add correct icon with as false.

member.summary: The source is the data of the pivotTable. If PivotSource is not empty ,the chart is PivotChart.
member.remarks: If the pivot table "PivotTable1" in the Worksheet "Sheet1" in the file "Book1.xls". The pivotSource could be "[Book1.xls]Sheet1!PivotTable1" if the chart and the PivotTable is not in the same workbook. If you set this property ,the previous data source setting will be lost.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.IsChartDataChanged
member.summary: Detects if a chart's data source has changed.
member.remarks: The method detects the changes in the chart's data source before rendering the chart to image format. At first Chart.toImage call, the chart source data (e.g. XValuesParseData, ValuesParseData) will be recorded. Before calling the Chart.toImage method again, call IsChartDataChanged method to check if Chart needs re-rendering.
member.returns: Returns true if the chart has changed otherwise returns false

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.GapWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.GapDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the data series in a 3-D chart, as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Calculate
member.summary: Calculates the custom position of plot area, axes if the position of them are auto assigned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Floor
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the walls of a 3-D chart.
member.remarks: This property doesn't apply to 3-D pie charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Walls
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the walls of a 3-D chart.
member.remarks: This property doesn't apply to 3-D pie charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.BackWall
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the back wall of a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.SideWall
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the side wall of a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.WallsAndGridlines2D
member.summary: True if gridlines are drawn two-dimensionally on a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.RotationAngle
member.summary: Represents the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis, in degrees).
member.remarks: The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Elevation
member.summary: Represents the elevation of the 3-D chart view, in degrees.
member.remarks: The chart elevation is the height at which you view the chart, in degrees. The default is 15 for most chart types. The value of this property must be between -90 and 90, except for 3-D bar charts, where it must be between 0 and 44.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: True if the chart axes are at right angles.Applies only for 3-D charts(except Column3D and 3-D Pie Charts).
member.remarks: If this property is True, the Perspective property is ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.AutoScaling
member.summary: True if Microsoft Excel scales a 3-D chart so that it's closer in size to the equivalent 2-D chart. The RightAngleAxes property must be True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.HeightPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets the perspective for the 3-D chart view. Must be between 0 and 100. This property is ignored if the RightAngleAxes property is True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Is3D
member.summary: Indicates whether the chart is a 3d chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.DepthPercent
member.summary: Represents the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file. The extension of the file name determines the format of the image.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
member.remarks: The format of the image is specified by using the extension of the file name. For example, if you specify "myfile.png", then the image will be saved in the PNG format. The following file extensions are recognized: .bmp, .gif, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .tif, .emf. If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file in the Jpeg format.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
member.remarks: If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a stream in the Jpeg format.
member.remarks: If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file. The extension of the file name determines the format of the image.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
member.remarks: The format of the image is specified by using the extension of the file name. For example, if you specify "myfile.png", then the image will be saved in the PNG format. member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the data points with value less than Split Position in the second chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.PercentValue
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the points with percentage less than Split Position percent in the second chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.Custom
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart according to the Custom Split values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.Auto
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split using the default mechanism for this chart type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea
member.summary: Encapsulates the object that represents the plot area in a chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea.X
member.summary: Gets or gets the x coordinate of the upper left corner of plot-area bounding box in units of 1/4000 of the chart area.

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the default value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea.Y
member.summary: Gets or gets the y coordinate of the upper top corner of plot-area bounding box in units of 1/4000 of the chart area.

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the default value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the default value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea.InnerY
member.summary: Gets or gets the x coordinate of the upper top corner of plot area in units of 1/4000 of the chart area.

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the default value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea.InnerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of plot area in units of 1/4000 of the chart area.

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the default value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea.InnerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of plot area in units of 1/4000 of the chart area.

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the default value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

member.summary: True if the chart has drop lines. Applies only to line chart or area charts.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the drop lines for a series on the line chart or area chart. Applies only to line chart or area charts.

member.summary: True if a line chart has up and down bars. Applies only to line charts.

member.summary: Returns an DropBars object that represents the up bars on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

member.summary: Represents if the color of points is varied. The chart must contain only one series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.GapWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the first pie-chart or doughnut-chart slice, in degrees (clockwise from vertical). Applies only to pie, 3-D pie, and doughnut charts, 0 to 360.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how bars and columns are positioned. Can be a value between C 100 and 100. Applies only to 2-D bar and 2-D column charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SecondPlotSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the secondary section of either a pie of pie chart or a bar of pie chart, as a percentage of the size of the primary pie. Can be a value from 5 to 200.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SplitType
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that how to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie of pie or bar of pie chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SplitValue
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that shall be used to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie of pie or bar of pie chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.IsAutoSplit
member.summary: Indicates whether the threshold value is automatic.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.BubbleScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale factor for bubbles in the specified chart group. It can be an integer value from 0 (zero) to 300, corresponding to a percentage of the default size. Applies only to bubble charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SizeRepresents
member.summary: Gets or sets what the bubble size represents on a bubble chart.
member.remarks: BubbleSizeRepresents.SizeIsArea means the value is the area of the bubble. BubbleSizeRepresents.SizeIsWidth means the value is the width of the bubble.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.ShowNegativeBubbles
member.summary: True if negative bubbles are shown for the chart group. Valid only for bubble charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.DoughnutHoleSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the hole in a doughnut chart group. The hole size is expressed as a percentage of the chart size, between 10 and 90 percent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.Explosion
member.summary: The distance of an open pie slice from the center of the pie chart is expressed as a percentage of the pie diameter.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.SeriesCollection.AddR1C1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the collection to a chart.
member.param: Specifies values from which to plot the data series
Specifies whether to plot the series from a range of cell values by row or by column.
member.returns: Return the first index of the added ASeries in the NSeries.

remarks.br: If set data on contiguous cells, use colon to seperate them.For example, R[1]C[1]:R[3]C[2].
If set data on contiguous cells, use comma to seperate them.For example,(R[1]C[1],R[3]C[2]).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.SeriesCollection.Add(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the collection to a chart.
member.param: Specifies values from which to plot the data series
Specifies whether to plot the series from a range of cell values by row or by column.
member.returns: Return the first index of the added ASeries in the NSeries.

remarks.br: If set data on contiguous cells, use colon to seperate them.For example, $C$2:$C$5.
If set data on non contiguous cells, use comma to seperate them.For example: ($C$2,$D$5).

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition
member.summary: Specifies the axis position for a range of cells with conditional formatting as data bars.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.Automatic
member.summary: Display the axis at a variable position based on the ratio of the minimum negative value to the maximum positive value in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction. When all values are positive or all values are negative, no axis is displayed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.Midpoint
member.summary: Display the axis at the midpoint of the cell regardless of the set of values in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.None
member.summary: No axis is displayed, and both positive and negative values are displayed in the left-to-right direction.

member.summary: Represents the border of the data bars specified by a conditional formatting rule.

member.summary: Gets or sets the border's color of data bars specified by a conditional formatting rule.

member.summary: Gets or sets the border's type of data bars specified by a conditional formatting rule.

member.summary: Specifies the border type of a data bar.

member.summary: The data bar has no border.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarBorderType.Solid
member.summary: The data bar has a solid border.

member.summary: The data bar is filled with solid color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarFillType.Gradient
member.summary: The data bar is filled with a color gradient.

member.summary: Specifies whether to use the same border and fill color as positive data bars.

member.summary: Use the color specified in the Negative Value and Axis Setting dialog box or by using the ColorType and BorderColorType properties of the NegativeBarFormat object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarNegativeColorType.SameAsPositive
member.summary: Use the same color as positive data bars.

member.summary: Represents the color settings of the data bars for negative values that are defined by a data bar conditional formatting rule.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.NegativeBarFormat.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a FormatColor object that you can use to specify the border color for negative data bars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.NegativeBarFormat.BorderColorType
member.summary: Gets whether to use the same border color as positive data bars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.NegativeBarFormat.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets a FormatColor object that you can use to specify the fill color for negative data bars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.NegativeBarFormat.ColorType
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use the same fill color as positive data bars.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage
member.summary: Describe the AboveAverage conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.IsAboveAverage
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether the rule is an "above average" rule. 'true' indicates 'above average'. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.IsEqualAverage
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether the 'aboveAverage' and 'belowAverage' criteria is inclusive of the average itself, or exclusive of that value. 'true' indicates to include the average value in the criteria. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.StdDev
member.summary: Get or set the number of standard deviations to include above or below the average in the conditional formatting rule. The input value must between 0 and 3 (include 0 and 3). Setting this value to 0 means stdDev is not set. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale
member.summary: Describe the ColorScale conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule creates a gradated color scale on the cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.Is3ColorScale
member.summary: Indicates whether conditional formatting is 3 color scale.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MinCfvo
member.summary: Get or set this ColorScale's min value object. Cannot set null or CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Max to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MidCfvo
member.summary: Get or set this ColorScale's mid value object. Cannot set CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Max or FormatConditionValueType.Min to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MaxCfvo
member.summary: Get or set this ColorScale's max value object. Cannot set null or CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Min to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MinColor
member.summary: Get or set the min value object's corresponding color.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MidColor
member.summary: Get or set the mid value object's corresponding color.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MaxColor
member.summary: Get or set the max value object's corresponding color.

member.summary: True, no rules with lower priority may be applied over this rule, when this rule evaluates to true. Only applies for Excel 2007;

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.Priority
member.summary: The priority of this conditional formatting rule. This value is used to determine which format should be evaluated and rendered. Lower numeric values are higher priority than higher numeric values, where '1' is the highest priority.

member.summary: Gets or setts style of conditional formatted cell ranges.

member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "IconSet" instance. The default instance's IconSetType is TrafficLights31. Valid only for type = IconSet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.DataBar
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "DataBar" instance. The default instance's color is blue. Valid only for type is DataBar.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.ColorScale
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "ColorScale" instance. The default instance is a "green-yellow-red" 3ColorScale . Valid only for type = ColorScale.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.Top10
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "Top10" instance. The default instance's rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top 10 bracket. Valid only for type is Top10.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.AboveAverage
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "AboveAverage" instance. The default instance's rule highlights cells that are above the average for all values in the range. Valid only for type = AboveAverage.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.Text
member.summary: The text value in a "text contains" conditional formatting rule. Valid only for type = containsText, notContainsText, beginsWith and endsWith. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.TimePeriod
member.summary: The applicable time period in a "date occurring" conditional formatting rule. Valid only for type = timePeriod. The default value is TimePeriodType.Today.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType
member.summary: Conditional format rule type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.CellValue
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule compares a cell value to a formula calculated result, using an operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.Expression
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule contains a formula to evaluate. When the formula result is true, the cell is highlighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ColorScale
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule creates a gradated color scale on the cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.DataBar
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule displays a gradated data bar in the range of cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.IconSet
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule applies icons to cells according to their values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.Top10
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top N or bottom N bracket, as specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.UniqueValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights unique values in the range.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.DuplicateValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights duplicated values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing given text. Equivalent to using the SEARCH() sheet function to determine whether the cell contains the text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.BeginsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells in the range that begin with the given text. Equivalent to using the LEFT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.EndsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells ending with given text. Equivalent to using the RIGHT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are completely blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells with formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells without formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.TimePeriod
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing dates in the specified time period. The underlying value of the cell is evaluated, therefore the cell does not need to be formatted as a date to be evaluated. For example, with a cell containing the value 38913 the conditional format shall be applied if the rule requires a value of 7/14/2006.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.AboveAverage
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType
member.summary: Condition value type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Formula
member.summary: The minimum/ midpoint / maximum value for the gradient is determined by a formula.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Max
member.summary: Indicates that the maximum value in the range shall be used as the maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Min
member.summary: Indicates that the minimum value in the range shall be used as the minimum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Number
member.summary: Indicates that the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient is specified by a constant numeric value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Percent
member.summary: Value indicates a percentage between the minimum and maximum values in the range shall be used as the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Percentile
member.summary: Value indicates a percentile ranking in the range shall be used as the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.AutomaticMax
member.summary: Indicates that the Automatic maximum value in the range shall be used as the Automatic maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.AutomaticMin
member.summary: Indicates that the Automatic minimum value in the range shall be used as the Automatic minimum value for the gradient.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.ReferToSheetWithSameName
member.summary: When copying a worksheet to another workbook and the worksheet contains the formulas which refer to other worksheets in MS Excel, the copied formulas should refer to source workbook. But sometimes we have copied other worksheets and we hope the copied formulas refer to other worksheets with the name in the same workbook, please set this property as true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.ReferToDestinationSheet
member.summary: When copying the range in the same file and the chart refers to the source sheet, False means the copied chart's data source will not be changed. True means the copied chart's data source refers to the destination sheet.
member.remarks: The default value is false, it works as MS Excel.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.CustomImplementationFactory
member.summary: Factory to create some instances which may be re-implemented by user for special purpose.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.CustomImplementationFactory.CreateMemoryStream
member.summary: Create one instance of MemoryStream or custom implementation of MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.CustomImplementationFactory.CreateMemoryStream(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create one instance of MemoryStream or custom implementation of MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.CustomImplementationFactory.CreateCultureInfo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create one CultureInfo by given id.
member.remarks: This implementation is useful for situations: 1. Some cultures may not be supported by user's environment and creating the required CultureInfo with given identifier may cause Exception. To avoid the exception, user may override this method to provide a valid CultureInfo instance for the unsupported one. 2. User may want to specify some custom properties for some cultures to get expected result for formatting. For this purpose user may override this method to provide the CultureInfo instance with user specified properties. Please note UseUserOverride property of the returned CultureInfo instance may influence the formatted result. If it is false, some properties of the returned CultureInfo instance may be overridden by our built-in formatting engine according to the formatting requirements of different scenarios. If it is true, we will not change any properties of it and use it to format values directly. So, if user has specified custom properties for the returned CultureInfo instance, please make sure its UseUserOverride is true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Properties.BuiltInDocumentPropertyCollection
member.summary: A collection of built-in document properties.

remarks.p: Provides access to objects by their names (using an indexer) and via a set of typed properties that return values of appropriate types.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Properties.BuiltInDocumentPropertyCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a object by the name of the property.

remarks.p: The string names of the properties correspond to the names of the typed properties available from .

If you request a property that is not present in the document, but the name of the property is recognized as a valid built-in name, a new is created, added to the collection and returned. The newly created property is assigned a default value (empty string, zero, false or DateTime.MinValue depending on the type of the built-in property).
If you request a property that is not present in the document and the name is not recognized as a built-in name, a null is returned.

member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property to retrieve.

member.remarks: When set, it associates with corresponding .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DigitalSignatures.DigitalSignature.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text of actual signature in the digital signature. Default value ise Empty.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DigitalSignatures.DigitalSignature.Image
member.summary: Specifies an image for the digital signature. Default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DigitalSignatures.DigitalSignature.ProviderId
member.summary: Specifies the class ID of the signature provider. Default value is Empty (all zeroes) Guid.
member.remarks:
The cryptographic service provider (CSP) is an independent software module that actually performs cryptography algorithms for authentication, encoding, and encryption. Microsoft Office reserves the value of {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} for its default signature provider, and {000CD6A4-0000-0000-C000-000000000046} for its East Asian signature provider.
The GUID of the additionally installed provider should be obtained from the documentation shipped with the provider.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.CheckMixedValueType

member.summary: Specifies all properties associated with an ODBC or OLE DB external data connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.ConnectionInfo
member.summary: The connection information string is used to make contact with an OLE DB or ODBC data source.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.PowerQueryFormula
member.summary: Gets the definition of power query formula.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.CommandType
member.summary: Specifies the OLE DB command type. 1. Query specifies a cube name 2. Query specifies a SQL statement 3. Query specifies a table name 4. Query specifies that default information has been given, and it is up to the provider how to interpret. 5. Query is against a web based List Data Provider.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.Command
member.summary: The string containing the database command to pass to the data provider API that will interact with the external source in order to retrieve data

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.SeverCommand
member.summary: Specifies a second command text string that is persisted when PivotTable server-based page fields are in use. For ODBC connections, serverCommand is usually a broader query than command (no WHERE clause is present in the former). Based on these 2 commands(Command and ServerCommand), parameter UI can be populated and parameterized queries can be constructed

member.summary: Specifies an external data connection

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Id
member.summary: Gets the id of the connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.PowerQueryFormula
member.summary: Gets the definition of power query formula.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Type
member.summary: Gets or Sets the external connection DataSource type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SourceFile
member.summary: Used when the external data source is file-based. When a connection to such a data source fails, the spreadsheet application attempts to connect directly to this file. May be expressed in URI or system-specific file path notation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SSOId
member.summary: Identifier for Single Sign On (SSO) used for authentication between an intermediate spreadsheetML server and the external data source.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SavePassword
member.summary: True if the password is to be saved as part of the connection string; otherwise, False.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SaveData
member.summary: True if the external data fetched over the connection to populate a table is to be saved with the workbook; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.RefreshOnLoad
member.summary: True if this connection should be refreshed when opening the file; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ReconnectionMethodType
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails. The default value is ReConnectionMethodType.Required.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ReconnectionMethod
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails. The default value is ReConnectionMethodType.Required.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Instead, please use ExternalConnection.ReconnectionMethodType property. This property will be removed 12 months later since October 2017. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.OnlyUseConnectionFile
member.summary: Indicates whether the spreadsheet application should always and only use the connection information in the external connection file indicated by the odcFile attribute when the connection is refreshed. If false, then the spreadsheet application should follow the procedure indicated by the reconnectionMethod attribute

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.OdcFile
member.summary: Specifies the full path to external connection file from which this connection was created. If a connection fails during an attempt to refresh data, and reconnectionMethod=1, then the spreadsheet application will try again using information from the external connection file instead of the connection object embedded within the workbook.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.IsNew
member.summary: True if the connection has not been refreshed for the first time; otherwise, false. This state can happen when the user saves the file before a query has finished returning.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the connection. Each connection must have a unique name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.KeepAlive
member.summary: True when the spreadsheet application should make efforts to keep the connection open. When false, the application should close the connection after retrieving the information.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.RefreshInternal
member.summary: Specifies the number of minutes between automatic refreshes of the connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ConnectionId
member.summary: Specifies The unique identifier of this connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ConnectionDescription
member.summary: Specifies the user description for this connection

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.IsDeleted
member.summary: Indicates whether the associated workbook connection has been deleted. true if the connection has been deleted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.CredentialsMethodType
member.summary: Specifies the authentication method to be used when establishing (or re-establishing) the connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Credentials
member.summary: Specifies the authentication method to be used when establishing (or re-establishing) the connection.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection
member.summary: Specifies the properties for a web query source. A web query will retrieve data from HTML tables, and can also supply HTTP "Get" parameters to be processed by the web server in generating the HTML by including the parameters and parameter elements.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXml
member.summary: true if the web query source is XML (versus HTML), otherwise false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXl97
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadsheet files, and is set to true if this web query was created in Microsoft Excel 97. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXl2000
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadsheet files, and is set to true if this web query was refreshed in a spreadsheet application newer than or equal to Microsoft Excel 2000. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.Url
member.summary: URL to use to refresh external data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsTextDates
member.summary: Flag indicating whether dates should be imported into cells in the worksheet as text rather than dates.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXmlSourceData
member.summary: Flag indicating that XML source data should be imported instead of the HTML table itself.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.Post
member.summary: Returns or sets the string used with the post method of inputting data into a web server to return data from a web query.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsParsePre
member.summary: Flag indicating whether data contained within HTML PRE tags in the web page is parsed into columns when you import the page into a query table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsHtmlTables
member.summary: Flag indicating whether web queries should only work on HTML tables.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.HtmlFormat
member.summary: How to handle formatting from the HTML source when bringing web query data into the worksheet. Relevant when sourceData is True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsSameSettings
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to parse all tables inside a PRE block with the same width settings as the first row.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.EditWebPage
member.summary: The URL of the user-facing web page showing the web query data. This URL is persisted in the case that sourceData="true" and url has been redirected to reference an XML file. Then the user-facing page can be shown in the UI, and the XML data can be retrieved behind the scenes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.EditPage
member.summary: The URL of the user-facing web page showing the web query data. This URL is persisted in the case that sourceData="true" and url has been redirected to reference an XML file. Then the user-facing page can be shown in the UI, and the XML data can be retrieved behind the scenes.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Instead, please use WebQueryConnection.EditWebPage property. This property will be removed 12 months later since October 2017. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsConsecutive
member.summary: Flag indicating whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as just one delimiter.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter
member.summary: Specifies properties about any parameters used with external data connections Parameters are valid for ODBC and web queries.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.SqlType
member.summary: SQL data type of the parameter. Only valid for ODBC sources.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.RefreshOnChange
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the query should automatically refresh when the contents of a cell that provides the parameter value changes. If true, then external data is refreshed using the new parameter value every time there's a change. If false, then external data is only refreshed when requested by the user, or some other event triggers refresh (e.g., workbook opened).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt string for the parameter. Presented to the spreadsheet user along with input UI to collect the parameter value before refreshing the external data. Used only when parameterType = prompt.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Type
member.summary: Type of parameter used. If the parameterType=value, then the value from boolean, double, integer, or string will be used. In this case, it is expected that only one of {boolean, double, integer, or string} will be specified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.CellReference
member.summary: Cell reference indicating which cell's value to use for the query parameter. Used only when parameterType is cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Value
member.summary: Non-integer numeric value,Integer value,String value or Boolean value to use as the query parameter. Used only when parameterType is value.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType.Required
member.summary: On refresh use the existing connection information and if it ends up being invalid then get updated connection information, if available from the external connection file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType.Always
member.summary: On every refresh get updated connection information from the external connection file, if available, and use that instead of the existing connection information. In this case the data refresh will fail if the external connection file is unavailable.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType.Never
member.summary: Never get updated connection information from the external connection file even if it is available and even if the existing connection information is invalid

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ParameterType
member.summary: Represents all parameters' type or return value type of function.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine
member.summary: Represents user's custom calculation engine to extend the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells.
member.remarks: User should not modify any part of the Workbook directly in this implementation(except the calculated result of the custom function, which can be set by CalculationData.CalculatedValue property). Otherwise unexpected result or Exception may be caused. If user needs to change other data than calculated result in the implementation for some custom functions, for example, change cell's formula, style, ...etc., user should gather those data in this implementation and change them out of the scope of formula calculation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine.Calculate(Aspose.Cells.CalculationData)
member.summary: Calculates one function with given data.
member.param: the required data to calculate function such as function name, parameters, ...etc.
member.remarks: User should set the calculated value for given data for all functions(including excel native functions) that he wants to calculate by himself in this implementation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine.IsParamLiteralRequired
member.summary: Indicates whether this engine needs the literal text of parameter while doing calculation. Default value is false.
member.remarks: If this custom calculation engine requires the parameter's literal text, more stacks will be required to cache the literal text for parameters and Calculate() method may be called recursively to calculate the parameter's value. Commonly the literal text is not needed for calculating formulas and this method should return false for most implementations to get better performance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine.ProcessBuiltInFunctions
member.summary: Whether built-in functions that have been supported by the built-in engine should be checked and processed by this implementation. Default is false. If user needs to change the calculation logic of some built-in functions, this property should be set as true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor
member.summary: Monitor for user to track the progress of formula calculation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.OriginalValue
member.summary: Gets the old value of the calculated cell. Should be used only in and .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.ValueChanged
member.summary: Whether the cell's value has been changed after the calculation. Should be used only in .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.CalculatedValue
member.summary: Gets the newly calculated value of the cell. Should be used only in .

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.BeforeCalculate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Implement this method to do business before calculating one cell.
member.param: Index of the sheet that the cell belongs to.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.AfterCalculate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Implement this method to do business after one cell has been calculated.
member.param: Index of the sheet that the cell belongs to.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.OnCircular(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Implement this method to do business when calculating formulas with circular references.
member.param: IEnumerator with CalculationCell items representing cells that depend on circular references.
member.returns: Whether the formula engine needs to calculate those cells in circular after this call. True to let the formula engine continue to do calculation for them. False to let the formula engine just mark those cells as Calculated.
member.remarks: In the implementation user may also set the expected value as calculated result for part/all of those cells so the formula engine will not calculate them recursively.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell
member.summary: Represents the calculation relevant data about one cell which is being calculated.
member.remarks: All objects provided by this class are for "read" purpose only. User should not change any data in the Workbook during the formula calculation process, Otherwise unexpected result or Exception may be caused.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell.SetCalculatedValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the calculated value for the cell.
member.remarks: User can set the calculated result by this method to ignore the automatic calculation for the cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell.Workbook
member.summary: Gets the Workbook object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell.Worksheet
member.summary: Gets the Worksheet object where the cell is in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell.CellRow
member.summary: Gets the row index of the cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell.CellColumn
member.summary: Gets the column index of the cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationCell.Cell
member.summary: Gets the Cell object which is being calculated.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData
member.summary: Represents the required data when calculating one function, such as function name, parameters, ...etc.
member.remarks: All objects provided by this class are for "read" purpose only. User should not change any data in the Workbook during the formula calculation process, Otherwise unexpected result or Exception may be caused.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.CalculatedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the calculated value for this function.
member.remarks: User should set this property in his custom calculation engine for those functions the engine supports, and the set value will be returned when getting this property later. The set value can be any value of those objects that can be set to a Cell(Cell.Value). And it can also be array of such kind of values, or a Range, Name, ReferredArea. Getting this property before setting will make the function be calculated by the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells and the calculated value will be returned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.Workbook
member.summary: Gets the Workbook object where the function is in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.Worksheet
member.summary: Gets the Worksheet object where the function is in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.CellRow
member.summary: Gets the row index of the cell where the function is in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.CellColumn
member.summary: Gets the column index of the cell where the function is in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.Cell
member.summary: Gets the Cell object where the function is in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.FunctionName
member.summary: Gets the function name to be calculated.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.ParamCount
member.summary: Gets the count of parameters

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.GetParamValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the represented value object of the parameter at given index.
member.returns: If the parameter is plain value, then returns the plain value. If the parameter is reference, then returns ReferredArea object. If the parameter references to multiple datasets, then returns array of objects.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.GetParamText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the literal text of the parameter at given index.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions
member.summary: Represents options for calculation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.IgnoreError
member.summary: Indicates if you need to hide the error in calculating formulas. The error may be unsupported function, external links, etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CustomFunction
member.summary: The custom formula calculation functions to extend the calculation engine.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use CustomEngine property, AbstractCalculationEngine provides more convenient and flexible APIs for manipulating custom functions. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2020. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CustomEngine
member.summary: The custom formula calculation engine to extend the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CalculationMonitor
member.summary: The monitor for user to track the progress of formula calculation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CalcStackSize
member.summary: Specifies the stack size for calculating cells recursively. -1 for this property means the calculation will use WorkbookSettings.CalcStackSize of corresponding workbook.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.PrecisionStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the strategy for processing precision of calculation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Indicates whether calculate the dependent cells recursively when calculating one cell and it depends on other cells.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy
member.summary: Enumerates strategies for handling calculation precision. Because of the precision issue of IEEE 754 Floating-Point Arithmetic, some "seemingly simple" formulas may not be calculated as the expected result. Such as formula "=-0.45+0.43+0.02", when calculating operands by '+' operator directly, the result is not zero. For such kind of precision issue, some special strategies may give the expected result.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy.None
member.summary: No strategy applied on calculation. When calculating just use the original double value as operand and return the result directly. Most efficient for performance and applicable for most cases.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy.Round
member.summary: Rounds the calculation result according with significant digits.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy.Decimal
member.summary: Uses decimal as operands when possible. Most inefficient for performance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions
member.summary: Represents options when parsing formula.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions.LocaleDependent
member.summary: Whether the formula is locale formatted. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions.R1C1Style
member.summary: Whether the formula is R1C1 reference style. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions.CheckAddIn
member.summary: Whether check addins in existing external links of current workbook for user defined function without external link. Default is true(if user defined function matches one addin in existing external links, then take it as the addin).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormulaParseOptions.Parse
member.summary: Whether parse given formula. Default is true. If it is false, then given formula string will be kept as it is for the cell until user call other methods to parse them or parsed formula data is required by other operations such as calculating formulas.
