member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ICustomFunction
member.summary: Allows users to add their custom formula calculation functions to extend the calculation engine.
member.remarks:
User should not modify any part in the Workbook directly in this implementation. Otherwise unexpected result or Exception may be caused.
NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use AbstractCalculationEngine which provides more convenient and flexible APIs for manipulating custom functions. This interface will be removed 12 months later since August 2020. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.ICustomFunction.CalculateCustomFunction(System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Calculates the result of custom function.
member.param: A list of parameters value for custom functions.
member.remarks:
Currently there are 3 fixed context objects and some varialbe context objects:
1. Current Workbook object.
2. Current Worksheet object.
3. Current Cell object.
Others are custom function parameters text. If a custom function name is not supported, please return a null reference.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler
member.summary: Represents cells data handler for reading large spreadsheet files in light weight mode.
member.remarks: When reading a workbook by this mode, will be checked when reading every worksheet in the workbook. For one sheet, if gives true, then all data and properties of rows/cells of this sheet will be checked and processed by the implementation of this interface. For every row, will be called to check whether it need to be processed. If a row needs to be processed, properties of this row will be read firstly and user can access its properties by . if row's cells need to be processed too, then should returns true and then will be called for every existing cell in this row to check whether one cell need to be processed. If one cell needs to be processed, then will be called to process the cell by the implementation of this interface.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.StartSheet(Aspose.Cells.Worksheet)
member.summary: Starts to process a worksheet.
member.remarks: It will be called before reading cells data of a worksheet.
member.param: the worksheet to read cells data.
member.returns: whether this sheet's cells data needs to be processed. false to ignore this sheet.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.StartRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares to process a row.
member.param: the index of next row to be processed
member.returns: whether this row(properties or cells data) needs to be processed. false to ignore this row and its cells and check the next row.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.ProcessRow(Aspose.Cells.Row)
member.summary: Starts to process one row.
member.remarks: It will be called after row's properties such as height, style, ...etc. have been read. However, cells in this row has not been read yet.
member.param: Row object which is being processed currently.
member.returns: whether this row's cells need to be processed. false to ignore all cells in this row.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.StartCell(System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares to process a cell.
member.remarks: It will be called when reaching an existing cell in current row. Current row is the row of last call of .
member.param: column index of the cell to be processed
member.returns: whether this cell needs to be processed. false to ignore the cell and check the next one until reach the end of cells data of current row

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.ProcessCell(Aspose.Cells.Cell)
member.summary: Starts to process one cell.
member.remarks: It will be called after one cell's data has been read.
member.param: Cell object which is being processed currently
member.returns: whether this cell needs to be kept in cells model of current sheet. Commonly it should be false so that all cells will not be kept in memory after being processed and then memory be saved. For some special purpose such as user needs to access some cells later after the whole workbook having been processed, user can make this method return true to keep those special cells in Cells model and access them later by APIs such as Cells[row, column]. However, keeping cells data in Cells model will requires more memory and if all cells are kept then reading template file in LightCells mode will become same with reading it in normal way.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider
member.summary: Represents Data provider for saving large spreadsheet files in light weight mode.
member.remarks: When saving a workbook by this mode, will be checked when saving every worksheet in the workbook. For one sheet, if gives true, then all data and properties of rows/cells of this sheet to be saved will be provided by the implementation of this interface. In the first place, will be called to get the next row index to be saved. If a valid row index is returned(the row index must be in ascending order for the rows to be saved), then a Row object representing this row will be provided for implementation to set its properties by . For one row, will be checked firstly. If a valid column index be returned(the column index must be in ascending order for all cells of one row to be saved), then a Cell object representing this cell will be provided for implementation to set its data and properties by . After data of this cell is set, this cell will be saved directly to the generated spreadsheet file and the next cell will be checked and processed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.StartSheet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts to save a worksheet.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving a worksheet during saving a workbook. If the provider needs to refer to sheetIndex later in startRow(Row) or startCell(Cell) method, that is, if the process needs to know which worksheet is being processed, the implementation should retain the sheetIndex value here.
member.param: index of current sheet to be saved.
member.returns: true if this provider will provide data for the given sheet; false if given sheet should use its normal data model(Cells).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.NextRow
member.summary: Gets the next row to be saved.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving a row and its cells data(before ).
member.returns: the next row index to be saved. -1 means the end of current sheet data has been reached and no further row of current sheet to be saved.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.StartRow(Aspose.Cells.Row)
member.summary: Starts to save data of one row.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving a row and its cells data. If current row has some custom properties such as height, style, ...etc., implementation should set those properties to given Row object here.
member.param: Row object for implementation to fill data. Its row index is the returned value of latest call of . If the row has been initialized in the inner cells model, the existing row object will be used. Otherwise a temporary Row object will be used for implementation to fill data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.NextCell
member.summary: Gets next cell to be saved.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving one cell.
member.returns: column index of the next cell to be saved. -1 means the end of current row data has been reached and no further cell of current row to be saved.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.StartCell(Aspose.Cells.Cell)
member.summary: Starts to save data of one cell.
member.param: Cell object for implementation to fill data. Its column index is the returned value of latest call of . If the cell has been initialized in the inner cells model, the existed cell object will be used. Otherwise a temporary Cell object will be used for implementation to fill data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.IsGatherString
member.summary: Checks whether the current string value of cell needs to be gathered into a global pool.
member.remarks: Gathering string values will take advantage only when there are many duplicated string values for the cells provided by this implementation. In this situation gathering string will save much memory and generate smaller resultant file. If there are many string values for the cells provided by LightCellsDataProvider but few of them are same, gathering string will cost more memory and time and has no advantage for the resultant file.
member.returns: true if string value need to be gathered into a global pool for the resultant file.

member.summary: Gets and sets the interrupt monitor.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.IgnoreNotPrinted
member.summary: Ignore the data which are not printed if directly printing the file
member.remarks: Only for xlsx file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.CheckDataValid
member.summary: Check whether data is valid in the template file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.CheckExcelRestriction
member.summary: Whether check restriction of excel file when user modify cells related objects. For example, excel does not allow inputting string value longer than 32K. When you input a value longer than 32K such as by Cell.PutValue(string), if this property is true, you will get an Exception. If this property is false, we will accept your input string value as the cell's value so that later you can output the complete string value for other file formats such as CSV. However, if you have set such kind of value that is invalid for excel file format, you should not save the workbook as excel file format later. Otherwise there may be unexpected error for the generated excel file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.KeepUnparsedData
member.summary: Whether keep the unparsed data in memory for the Workbook when it is loaded from template file. Default is true.
member.remarks: For scenarios that user only needs to read some contents from template file and does not need to save the workbook back, set this property as false may improve performance, especially when using it together with some kind of LoadFilter,

member.summary: True means that the file contains several encoding.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.PreferredParsers
member.summary: Gets and sets preferred value parsers for loading text file.
member.remarks: parsers[0] is the parser will be used for the first column in text template file, parsers[1] is the parser will be used for the second column, ...etc. The last one(parsers[parsers.length-1]) will be used for all other columns start from parsers.length-1. If one item is null, the corresponding column will be parsed by the default parser of Aspose.Cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.HasFormula
member.summary: Indicates whether the text is formula if it starts with "=".

member.summary: Specifies the text qualifier for cell values. Default qualifier is '"'.
member.remarks: When setting this property, will become true automatically.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.TreatConsecutiveDelimitersAsOne
member.summary: Whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as one.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.TreatQuotePrefixAsValue
member.summary: Indicates whether the leading single quote sign should be taken as part of the value of one cell. Default is true. If it is false, the leading single quote will be removed from corresponding cell's value and will be set as true for the cell.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy
member.summary: Specifies how to apply style for parsed values when converting string value to number or datetime.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy.None
member.summary: Does not set style for the parsed value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy.BuiltIn
member.summary: Set the style as built-in number/datetime when the parsed value are plain numeric/datetime values.
member.remarks: When ms excel parsing datetime or numeric values according to user's input(such as CSV file), the formatting of those values may be changed, such as leading/tailing zeros of number, year/month/day order of datetime, ...etc. This type is for simulating ms excel's behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy.ExactFormat
member.summary: Set the exact custom format for the parsed value to make the formatted value be same with the original input one.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Metered
member.summary: Provides methods to set metered key.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to set metered public and private key
[C#]
Metered matered = new Metered(); matered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey");
[Visual Basic]
Dim matered As Metered = New Metered matered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Metered.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Metered.SetMeteredKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets metered public and private key. If you purchase metered license, when start application, this API should be called, normally, this is enough. However, if always fail to upload consumption data and exceed 24 hours, the license will be set to evaluation status, to avoid such case, you should regularly check the license status, if it is evaluation status, call this API again.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.SetHeader(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a script formatting the header of an Excel file.
member.remarks:
Script commands:
Command
Description
&P Current page number
&N Page count
&D Current date
&T Current time
&A Sheet name
&F File name without path
&"<FontName>" Font name, for example: &"Arial"
&"<FontName>, <FontStyle>" Font name and font style, for example: &"Arial,Bold"
&<FontSize> Font size. If this command is followed by a plain number to be printed in the header, it will be separated from the font height with a space character.
&"<K" Font color, for example(RED): &FF0000
&G Image script
For example: "&Arial,Bold&8Header Note"

members.member:
Sets a script formatting the footer of an Excel file.
0:Left Section.
1:Center Section
2:Right Section dddd Footer format script.
Script commands:
CommandDescription
&PCurrent page number
&NPage count
&DCurrent date
&TCurrent time
&ASheet name
&FFile name without path
&"<FontName>"Font name, for example: &"Arial"
&"<FontName>, <FontStyle>"Font name and font style, for example: &"Arial,Bold"
&<FontSize>Font size. If this command is followed by a plain number to be printed in the header, it will be separated from the font height with a space character.
&GImage script For example: "&Arial,Bold&8Footer Note"

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.IsHFScaleWithDoc
member.summary: Indicates whether header and footer are scaled with document scaling. Only applies for Excel 2007.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.IsHFAlignMargins
member.summary: Indicates whether header and footer margins are aligned with the page margins. If this property is true, the left header and footer will be aligned with the left margin, and the right header and footer will be aligned with the right margin. This option is enabled by default.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Protection
member.summary: Represents the various types of protection options available for a worksheet. Only used in ExcelXP and above version.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Protection.Copy(Aspose.Cells.Protection)
member.summary: Copy protection info.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.AllowDeletingColumn
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The columns containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsDeletingColumnsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The columns containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Protection.AllowDeletingColumn property. This property will be removed 12 months later since June 2010. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.AllowDeletingRow
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The rows containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsDeletingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The rows containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Protection.AllowDeletingRow property. This property will be removed 12 months later since June 2010. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to make use of an AutoFilter that was created before the sheet was protected.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsFilteringAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to make use of an AutoFilter that was created before the sheet was protected.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Protection.AllowFiltering property. This property will be removed 12 months later since June 2010. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.AllowFormattingCell
member.summary: Represents if the formatting of cells is allowed on a protected worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsFormattingCellsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the formatting of cells is allowed on a protected worksheet.

member.summary: Represents if the formatting of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Range.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator for cells in this Range.
member.remarks: When traversing elements by the returned Enumerator, the cells collection should not be modified(such as operations that will cause new Cell/Row be instantiated or existing Cell/Row be deleted). Otherwise the enumerator may not be able to traverse all cells correctly(some elements may be traversed repeatedly or skipped).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Range.IsIntersect(Aspose.Cells.Range)
member.summary: Indicates whether the range is intersect.
member.remarks: If the two ranges area not in the same worksheet ,return false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Range.Intersect(Aspose.Cells.Range)
member.summary: Returns a Range object that represents the rectangular intersection of two ranges.
member.remarks: If the two ranges are not intersected, returns null.

member.summary: Returns the union of two ranges.

member.summary: Applies formats for a whole range.

member.summary: Creates options for saving html file.

member.summary: Creates options for saving htm file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.PageTitle
member.summary: The title of the html page. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.AttachedFilesDirectory
member.summary: The directory that the attached files will be saved to. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.AttachedFilesUrlPrefix
member.summary: Specify the Url prefix of attached files such as image in the html file. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Specify the default font name for exporting html, the default font will be used when the font of style is not existing, If this property is null, Aspose.Cells will use universal font which have the same family with the original font, the default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.IsExportComments
member.summary: Indicates if exporting comments when saving file to html, the default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.DisableDownlevelRevealedComments
member.summary: Indicates if disable Downlevel-revealed conditional comments when exporting file to html, the default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.IsExpImageToTempDir
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting image files to temp directory. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageScalable
member.summary: Indicates whether using scalable unit to describe the image width when using scalable unit to describe the column width. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.WidthScalable
member.summary: Indicates whether using scalable unit to describe the column width when exporting file to html. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportSingleTab
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting the single tab when the file only has one worksheet. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportImagesAsBase64
member.summary: Specifies whether images are saved in Base64 format to HTML, MHTML or EPUB.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true image data is exported directly on the img elements and separate files are not created.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportActiveWorksheetOnly
member.summary: Indicates if exporting the whole workbook to html file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportPrintAreaOnly
member.summary: Indicates if only exporting the print area to html file. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportArea
member.summary: Gets or Sets the exporting CellArea of current active Worksheet. If you set this attribute, the print area of current active Worksheet will be omitted. Only the specified area will be exported when saving the file to html.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ParseHtmlTagInCell
member.summary:
Parse html tag in cell,like
,as cell value,or as html tag,default is true

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlCrossStringType
member.summary: Indicates if a cross-cell string will be displayed in the same way as MS Excel when saving an Excel file in html format. By default the value is Default, so, for cross-cell strings, there is little difference between the html files created by Aspose.Cells and MS Excel. But the performance for creating large html files,setting the value to Cross would be several times faster than setting it to Default or Fit2Cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.HiddenColDisplayType
P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.HiddenRowDisplayType
P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.Encoding
member.summary: If not set,use Encoding.UTF8 as default enconding type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportObjectListener
member.summary: Gets or sets the ExportObjectListener for exporting objects.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Instead, please use HtmlSaveOptions.IStreamProvider property. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2015. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.FilePathProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IFilePathProvider for exporting Worksheet to html separately.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.StreamProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IStreamProvider for exporting objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageOptions
member.summary: Get the ImageOrPrintOptions object before exporting

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportHiddenWorksheet
member.summary: Indicating if exporting the hidden worksheet content.The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.PresentationPreference
member.summary: Indicating if html or mht file is presentation preference.The default value is false.if you want to get more beautiful presentation,please set the value to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.CellCssPrefix
member.summary: Gets and sets the prefix of the css name,the default value is "".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.TableCssId
member.summary: Gets and sets the prefix of the type css name such as tr,col,td and so on, they are contained in the table element which has the specific TableCssId attribute. The default value is "".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.IsFullPathLink
member.summary: Indicating whether using full path link in sheet00x.htm,filelist.xml and tabstrip.htm. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportWorksheetCSSSeparately
member.summary: Indicating whether export the worksheet css separately.The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportSimilarBorderStyle
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting the similar border style when the border style is not supported by browsers. If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.MergeEmptyTdForcely
member.summary: Indicates whether merging empty TD element forcely when exporting file to html. The size of html file will be reduced significantly after setting value to true. The default value is false. If you want to import the html file to excel or export perfect grid lines when saving file to html, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportCellCoordinate
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting excel coordinate of nonblank cells when saving file to html. The default value is false. If you want to import the output html to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportExtraHeadings
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting extra headings when the length of text is longer than max display column. The default value is false. If you want to import the html file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportHeadings
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting headings when saving file to html.The default value is false. If you want to import the html file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportFormula
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting formula when saving file to html. The default value is true. If you want to import the output html to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.AddTooltipText
member.summary: Indicates whether adding tooltip text when the data can't be fully displayed. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportGridLines
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting the gridlines.The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportBogusRowData
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting bogus bottom row data. The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExcludeUnusedStyles
member.summary: Indicating whether excluding unused styles.The default value is false.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportDocumentProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting document properties.The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportWorksheetProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting worksheet properties.The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportWorkbookProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting workbook properties.The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportFrameScriptsAndProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting frame scripts and document properties. The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportDataOptions
member.summary: Indicating the rule of exporting html file data.The default value is All.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.LinkTargetType
member.summary: Indicating the type of target attribute in <a> link,The default value is HtmlLinkTargetType.Parent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.OoxmlSaveOptions.ExportCellName
member.summary: Indicates if export cell name to Excel2007 .xlsx (.xlsm, .xltx, .xltm) file. If the output file may be accessed by SQL Server DTS, this value must be true. member.remarks: The default value is false for performance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.OoxmlSaveOptions.EnableZip64

member.summary: Gets and sets the PdfBookmarkEntry object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Workbook converts to pdf will according to PdfCompliance in this property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.DefaultFont
member.summary: When characters in the Excel are unicode and not be set with correct font in cell style, They may appear as block in pdf,image. Set the DefaultFont such as MingLiu or MS Gothic to show these characters. If this property is not set, Aspose.Cells will use system default font to show these unicode characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CheckWorkbookDefaultFont
member.summary: When characters in the Excel are unicode and not be set with correct font in cell style, They may appear as block in pdf,image. Set this to true to try to use workbook's default font to show these characters first.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.SecurityOptions
member.summary: Set this options, when security is need in xls2pdf result.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.OnePagePerSheet
member.summary: If OnePagePerSheet is true , all content of one sheet will output to only one page in result. The paper size of pagesetup will be invalid, and the other settings of pagesetup will still take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.AllColumnsInOnePagePerSheet
member.summary: If AllColumnsInOnePagePerSheet is true , all column content of one sheet will output to only one page in result. The width of paper size of pagesetup will be ignored, and the other settings of pagesetup will still take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.ImageType
member.summary: Represents the image type when converting the chart and shape .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CalculateFormula
member.summary: Indicates whether calculate formulas before saving pdf file.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PdfCompression
member.summary: Indicate the compression algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.StreamProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IStreamProvider for exporting objects.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Border property. This property will be removed 12 months later since January 2018. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CheckFontCompatibility
member.summary: Indicates whether check font compatibility for every character in text.
member.remarks: The default value is true. Disable this property may give better performance. But when the default or specified font of text/character cannot be used to render it, unreadable characters(such as block) maybe occur in the generated pdf. For such situation user should keep this property as true so that alternative font can be searched and used to render the text instead;

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.SetImageResample(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets desired PPI(pixels per inch) of resample images and jpeg quality All images will be converted to JPEG with the specified quality setting, and images that are greater than the specified PPI (pixels per inch) will be resampled.
member.param: Desired pixels per inch. 220 high quality. 150 screen quality. 96 email quality.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the 0-based index of the first page to save.
member.remarks: Default is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PageCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages to save.
member.remarks: Default is System.Int32.MaxValue which means all pages will be rendered..

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CreatedTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the time of generating the pdf document.
member.remarks: if it is not be set, it will be the time of generating the pdf.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.OptimizationType
member.summary: Gets and sets pdf optimization type.
member.remarks: Default value is

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.IsFontSubstitutionCharGranularity
member.summary: Indicates whether only substitute the font of character when the cell font is not compatibility for it.
member.remarks: Default is false. We will try default font of Workbook and PdfSaveOption/system for cell font first.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.GridlineType
member.summary: Gets or sets gridline type.
member.remarks: Default is Dotted type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.TextCrossType
member.summary: Gets or sets displaying text type when the text width is larger than cell width.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.IgnoreError
member.summary: Indicates if you need to hide the error while rendering. The error can be error in shape, image, chart rendering, etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.OutputBlankPageWhenNothingToPrint
member.summary: Indicates whether to output a blank page when there is nothing to print.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.DrawObjectEventHandler
member.summary: Implements this interface to get DrawObject and Bound when rendering.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CustomPropertiesExport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the way are exported to PDF file. Default value is None.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.ExportDocumentStructure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not to export document structure.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PageSavingCallback
member.summary: Control/Indicate progress of page saving process.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.EmfRenderSetting
member.summary: Setting for rendering Emf metafile.
member.remarks: EMF metafiles identified as "EMF+ Dual" can contain both EMF+ records and EMF records. Either type of record can be used to render the image, only EMF+ records, or only EMF records. When is set, then EMF+ records will be parsed while rendering to pdf, otherwise only EMF records will be parsed. Default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: Indicate whether the window's title bar should display the document title.
member.remarks: If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.DefaultEditLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets default edit language.
member.remarks: It may display/render different layouts for text paragraph when different edit languages is set. Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.FontEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets embedded font encoding in pdf.
member.remarks: Default value is

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.AlwaysQuoted
member.summary: Indicates whether always adding '"' for each field. If true then all values will be quoted; If false then values will only be quoted when needed(for example, when values contain special characters such as '"' , '\n' or separator character). Default is false.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use QuoteType property instead. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2012. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.summary: Gets or sets how to quote values in the exported text file.

member.summary: Gets and sets the format strategy when exporting the cell value as string.

member.summary: The Data provider to provide cells data for saving workbook in light mode.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.TrimLeadingBlankRowAndColumn
member.summary: Indicates whether leading blank rows and columns should be trimmed like what ms excel does. Default is true.
member.remarks: When saving with LightCells mode, this option takes no effect. User should control the output range by the implementation of or by speicifing

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.KeepSeparatorsForBlankRow
member.summary: Indicates whether separators should be output for blank row. Default value is false so by default the content for blank row will be empty.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.ExportArea
member.summary: The range of cells to be exported.
member.remarks: If the exported area has been specified, will takes no effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.ExportQuotePrefix
member.summary: Indicates whether the single quote sign should be exported as part of the value of one cell when is true for it. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.ExportAllSheets
member.summary: Indicates whether exporting all sheets to the text file. If it is false, only export the activesheet, just like MS Excel.
member.remarks: The defult value is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType
member.summary: Specifies the type of using quotation marks for values in text format files.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Normal
member.summary: All values that contain special characters such as quotation mark, separator character will be quoted. Same with the behavior of ms excel for exporting text file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Always
member.summary: All values will be quoted always.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Minimum
member.summary: Only quote values when needed. Such as, if one value contains quotation mark but the quotation mark is not at the begin of this value, this value will not be quoted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Never
member.summary: All values will not be quoted. The exported text file with this type may not be read back correctly because the needed quotation marks being absent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.Number
member.summary: Gets or sets the display format of numbers and dates. The formatting patterns are different for different regions.
member.remarks:
For example, the formatting patterns represented by numbers for en_US region:
ValueTypeFormat String
0GeneralGeneral
1Decimal0
2Decimal0.00
3Decimal#,##0
4Decimal#,##0.00
5Currency$#,##0_);($#,##0)
6Currency$#,##0_);[Red]($#,##0)
7Currency$#,##0.00_);($#,##0.00)
8Currency$#,##0.00_);[Red]($#,##0.00)
9Percentage0%
10Percentage0.00%
11Scientific0.00E+00
12Fraction# ?/?
13Fraction# ??/??
14Datem/d/yyyy
15Dated-mmm-yy
16Dated-mmm
17Datemmm-yy
18Timeh:mm AM/PM
19Timeh:mm:ss AM/PM
20Timeh:mm
21Timeh:mm:ss
22Timem/d/yyyy h:mm
37Accounting#,##0_);(#,##0)
38Accounting#,##0_);[Red](#,##0)
39Accounting#,##0.00_);(#,##0.00)
40Accounting#,##0.00_);[Red](#,##0.00)
41Accounting_(* #,##0_);_(* (#,##0);_(* "-"_);_(@_)
42Currency_($* #,##0_);_($* (#,##0);_($* "-"_);_(@_)
43Accounting_(* #,##0.00_);_(* (#,##0.00);_(* "-"??_);_(@_)
44Currency_($* #,##0.00_);_($* (#,##0.00);_($* "-"??_);_(@_)
45Timemm:ss
46Time[h]:mm:ss
47Timemm:ss.0
48Scientific##0.0E+0
49Text@

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Style.SetBorder(Aspose.Cells.BorderType,Aspose.Cells.CellBorderType,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the borders of the style.
member.returns: Returns whether changing the current borders.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.IsLocked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a cell can be modified or not.
member.remarks: Locking cells has no effect unless the worksheet is protected.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Style.SetCustom(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the Custom number format string of a cell.
member.param: Custom number format string, should be InvariantCulture pattern.
If given Custom number format string matches one of the built-in number formats corresponding to current regional settings, whether set the number format as built-in instead of Custom.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.Custom
member.summary: Represents the custom number format string of this style object. If the custom number format is not set(For example, the number format is builtin), "" will be returned.
member.remarks: The returned custom string is culture-independent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.CultureCustom
member.summary: Gets and sets the culture-dependent pattern string for number format. If no number format has been set for this object, null will be returned. If number format is builtin, the pattern string corresponding to the builtin number will be returned.
member.remarks: For builtin number format, both the pattern content(such as, one builtin date format is "m/d/y" for some locales, but for some other locales it becomes "d/m/y") and the format specifier(such as, some locales is using character other than 'y' to represent the year part for date formatting) are culture-dependent; For user specified custom format, only format specifiers are changed according to the culture, other parts of the formatting pattern will not be modified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.InvariantCustom
member.summary: Gets the culture-independent pattern string for number format. If no number format has been set for this object, null will be returned. If number format is builtin, the pattern string corresponding to the builtin number will be returned.
member.remarks: For builtin number formats, the returned pattern content is still culture-dependent, such as, for some locales it returns "m/d/y" and for some other locales it returns "d/m/y". The difference from is(that is also what culture-independent means): the format specifiers and separators are kept as standard, such as '/' will always be used as datetime separator and "y" will always be used as the "year" part no matter what other special character is used for the specific locale.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.IsFormulaHidden
member.summary: Represents if the formula will be hidden when the worksheet is protected.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Validation.Areas
member.summary: Gets all which contain the data validation settings.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Validation.AddArea(Aspose.Cells.CellArea)
member.summary: Applies the validation to the area.
member.remarks: It is equivalent to use with checking intersection and edge.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Validation.AddArea(Aspose.Cells.CellArea,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies the validation to the area.
member.param: Whether check the intersection of given area with existing validations' areas. If one validation has been applied in given area(or part of it), then the existing validation should be removed at first from given area. Otherwise corruption may be caused for the generated Validations. If user is sure that the added area does not intersect with any existing area, this parameter can be set as false for performance consideration.

Whether check the edge of this validation's applied areas. Validation's internal settings depend on the top-left one of its applied ranges, so if given area will become the new top-left one of the applied ranges, the internal settings should be changed and rebuilt, otherwise unexpected result may be caused. If user is sure that the added area is not the top-left one, this parameter can be set as false for performance consideration.
member.remarks: In this method, we will remove all old validations in given area. For the top-left one of Validation's applied ranges, firstly its StartRow is smallest, secondly its StartColumn is the smallest one of those areas who have the same smallest StartRow.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Validation.AddAreas(Aspose.Cells.CellArea[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies the validation to given areas.
member.param: Whether check the intersection of given area with existing validations' areas. If one validation has been applied in given area(or part of it), then the existing validation should be removed at first from given area. Otherwise corruption may be caused for the generated Validations. If user is sure that all the added areas do not intersect with any existing area, this parameter can be set as false for performance consideration.

Whether check the edge of this validation's applied areas. Validation's internal settings depend on the top-left one of its applied ranges, so if one of given areas will become the new top-left one of the applied ranges, the internal settings should be changed and rebuilt, otherwise unexpected result may be caused. If user is sure that no one of those added areas is the top-left, this parameter can be set as false for performance consideration.
member.remarks: In this method, we will remove all old validations in given area. For the top-left one of Validation's applied ranges, firstly its StartRow is smallest, secondly its StartColumn is the smallest one of those areas who have the same smallest StartRow.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Workbook
member.summary: Represents a root object to create an Excel spreadsheet.
member.remarks: The Workbook class denotes an Excel spreadsheet. Each spreadsheet can contain multiple worksheets. The basic feature of the class is to open and save native excel files. The class has some advanced features like copying data from other Workbooks, combining two Workbooks and protecting the Excel spreadsheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.Settings
member.summary: Represents the workbook settings.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.example:
The following code shows how to use the Workbook constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the class.
[C#]
Workbook workbook = new Workbook();
[Visual Basic]
Dim workbook as Workbook = new Workbook()
member.remarks: The default file format type is Excel97To2003.If want create other format file type, please call Workbook(FileFormatType fileFormatType).

[C#]

[Visual Basic]

member.remarks: The default file format type is Excel97To2003.

member.param: whether ignore error for invalid formula. For one invalid formula, if ignore error then this formula will be ignored and the process will continue to parse other formulas, otherwise exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.StartAccessCache(Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions)
member.summary: Starts the session that uses caches to access data.
member.remarks:
If the cache of specified data access requires some data models in worksheet to be "read-only", then corresponding data models in every worksheet in this workbook will be taken as "read-only" and user should not change any of them.
After finishing the access to the data, should be invoked with same options to clear all caches and recover normal access mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.CloseAccessCache(Aspose.Cells.AccessCacheOptions)
member.summary: Closes the session that uses caches to access data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.Region
member.summary: Gets or sets the regional settings for workbook.
member.remarks: 1. Regional settings used by Aspose.Cells component for a workbook loaded from template file: i). For an XLS file, there are fields defined for regional settings and MS Excel does save regional settings data into the file when saving the XLS file. So, we use the saved region in the template file for the workbook. If you do not want to use the region saved in the XLS file, please reset it to the expected one (such as, CountryCode.Default) after loading the template file. And, we save the user specified value (by this method) into the file too when saving an XLS file. ii). For other file formats, such as, XLSX, XLSB...etc., there is no field defined for regional settings in the file format specification. So, we use the regional settings of application's environment for the workbook. And, the user specified value (by this method) cannot be kept for the generated files with those file formats. 2. For the view effect in MS Excel: The applied regional settings here can take effect only at runtime with Aspose.Cells component and not when viewing the generated file with MS Excel. Even for the generated XLS file in which the specified regional settings data has been saved, when viewing/editing it with MS Excel, the used region to perform formatting by MS Excel is always the default regional settings of the environment where MS Excel is running, not the one saved in the file. It is MS Excel's behavior and cannot be changed by code.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.CheckExcelRestriction
member.summary: Whether check restriction of excel file when user modify cells related objects. For example, excel does not allow inputting string value longer than 32K. When you input a value longer than 32K such as by Cell.PutValue(string), if this property is true, you will get an Exception. If this property is false, we will accept your input string value as the cell's value so that later you can output the complete string value for other file formats such as CSV. However, if you have set such kind of value that is invalid for excel file format, you should not save the workbook as excel file format later. Otherwise there may be unexpected error for the generated excel file.

members.member:
Query cell areas that mapped/linked to the specific path of xml map.
xml element path e.g. A xml map element structure:
-RootElement |-Attribute1 |-SubElement |-Attribute2 |-Attribute3
To query "Attribute1", path is "/RootElement/@Attribute1" To query "Attribute2", path is "/RootElement/SubElement/@Attribute2" To query whole "SubElement", path is "/RootElement/SubElement" Specify an xml map if you want to query for the specific path within a specific map list that mapped/linked to the specific path of xml map, an empty list is returned if nothing is mapped/linked.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorksheetCollection.XmlMaps

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorksheetCollection.BuiltInDocumentProperties
member.summary: Returns a DocumentProperties collection that represents all the built-in document properties of the spreadsheet.
member.remarks:
A new property cannot be added to built-in document properties list. You can only get a built-in property and change its value. The following is the built-in properties name list:
Title
Subject
Author
Keywords
Comments
Template
Last Author
Revision Number
Application Name
Last Print Date
Creation Date
Last Save Time
Total Editing Time
Number of Pages
Number of Words
Number of Characters
Security
Category
Format
Manager
Company
Number of Bytes
Number of Lines
Number of Paragraphs
Number of Slides
Number of Notes
Number of Hidden Slides
Number of Multimedia Clips

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorksheetCollection.CustomDocumentProperties
member.summary: Returns a DocumentProperties collection that represents all the custom document properties of the spreadsheet.

example.code:
[C#] excel.Worksheets.CustomDocumentProperties.Add("Checked by", "Jane");
[Visual Basic] excel.Worksheets.CustomDocumentProperties.Add("Checked by", "Jane")
